channels.summary: Channel used to share academic OSINT resources, articles on methodology and ethics, and news affecting research and survey data quality.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute article on open-source reporting in the Israel–Hamas war
highlights.details: Reuters Institute piece examining both the power and limits of open-source reporting in covering the Israel–Hamas conflict was shared as a teaching resource for OSINT courses.

highlights.title: 404 Media: AI agent that evades online survey detection
highlights.details: Article describing a research AI agent that can complete online surveys while evading bot-detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns about AI poisoning academic survey data and the wider knowledge ecosystem.

highlights.title: Utrecht University Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: Link to Utrecht University’s lab focused on open-source investigations for global justice, useful for students and academics working on accountability and international law.

highlights.title: Queen’s Belfast GLAN programme
highlights.details: Shared link to the Queen’s University Belfast School of Law programme associated with GLAN, relevant for those interested in legal aspects of open-source investigations.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat podcast RSS feed
highlights.details: RSS feed for Bellingcat’s Stage Talk recordings was shared as a place to catch up on talks relevant to academic OSINT and methods.

highlights.title: Ethics of death voyeurism in media coverage
highlights.details: New York Times opinion and Guardian photography-criticism pieces were shared to prompt discussion of ‘death voyeurism’ and ethical issues around moment-of-death imagery in journalism and awards.

highlights.title: Terence Tao statement on research suspension rumors
highlights.details: A Mathstodon post by mathematician Terence Tao was shared in response to rumors that his research had been suspended in connection with political actions against UCLA, providing a primary source update.

highlights.title: Nature News article d41586-025-00938-y
highlights.details: A Nature News article (ID d41586-025-00938-y) was shared for additional academic context, though without discussion of details in-channel.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
Queen’s University Belfast School of Law

channels.summary: Central hub for official Bellingcat server updates, event announcements, investigations, and community opportunities.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with Mareike Vitt on funding investigative work
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk with Bellingcat’s fundraiser Mareike Vitt on practical ways to fund open-source research projects and ‘your own Bellingcat’.

highlights.title: Investigation of federal enforcement in Washington, DC
highlights.details: Update on a project documenting federal enforcement actions in Washington, DC, verifying 42 encounters in less than a month of federal control, many involving DC police.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on Identifying Explosive Ordnance (EO)
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk on identifying explosive ordnance and current EO use in conflicts, shared as an educational resource via the podcast feed.

highlights.title: Open Source Munitions Portal Stage Talk and podcast
highlights.details: Link to the Stage Talk recording on the Open Source Munitions Portal, covering how to use the portal for ordnance identification and conflict research.

highlights.title: Bellingcat cold-case murder investigation video
highlights.details: Video featuring a Bellingcat researcher showing how open-source methods can uncover details about decades-old murders involving mafia, gamblers, and pigeons.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenges platform
highlights.details: Multiple announcements highlighted the challenge.bellingcat.com platform where users can attempt OSINT puzzles and discuss solutions in dedicated server channels.

highlights.title: Investigation of grain imports from a sanctioned Crimean port to Saudi Arabia
highlights.details: Bellingcat and Lloyd’s List uncovered another case of Russia’s shadow fleet shipping grain directly from a sanctioned port in occupied Crimea to Saudi Arabia.

highlights.title: Tracking a US federal agent’s movements with less-lethal weapon
highlights.details: Announcement of an investigation with Evident Media that reconstructs the movements of one federal agent wielding a less-lethal weapon at protests using open-source methods.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with DoubleThinkLab on FIMI and inauthentic accounts
highlights.details: Promotion of a Stage Talk with Jasper Hewitt of DoubleThinkLab on monitoring inauthentic accounts and investigating Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference (FIMI).

highlights.title: Dedicated forum post for Epstein-related content
highlights.details: Moderation update creating a dedicated, mute-able forum thread for Epstein-related discussion as a harm-reduction measure for the community.

highlights.title: Stage Talk on using OSINT to investigate murder mysteries
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk with Bellingcat’s Peter Barth on applying open-source techniques to historical murder cases.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environment investigations
highlights.details: Bellingcat invited submissions of open-source investigations on wildlife and environmental topics, stressing that contributors need not be journalists but must meet rigorous fact-checking standards.

channels.summary: Light but focused activity on potential geolocation targets in the Asia-Pacific region.

highlights.title: Suspected airship/balloon infrastructure in remote China
highlights.details: User noted interesting hangars and a mooring pole for airships/balloons in a remote part of China, suggesting further satellite imagery analysis.

highlights.title: Geolocation comparison of two islands off Myanmar
highlights.details: Link shared inviting others to compare imagery of two islands off the coast of Myanmar as a geolocation challenge.

channels.summary: Channel shared investigative resources and news on cultural heritage crime, as well as practical tips for research.

highlights.title: Harvard Law School Library’s digitized Nuremberg Trials collection
highlights.details: Announcement that Harvard Law School Library has released the full, searchable English-language evidentiary documents and transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, a major resource for WWII-era restitution and provenance claims.

highlights.title: Europol-coordinated takedown of cultural goods trafficking network
highlights.details: Europol press release shared about a Bulgarian-led operation dismantling a large criminal network trafficking cultural goods across Europe and beyond.

highlights.title: IFAR publications now free on Internet Archive
highlights.details: News that formerly paywalled International Foundation for Art Research (IFAR) publications are now digitized and freely available on Internet Archive, providing rich historical data for attribution and provenance research.

highlights.title: US disbands cultural property investigations in favor of immigration enforcement
highlights.details: Denver Post article shared about Homeland Security’s Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program being effectively dismantled as agents are reassigned to immigration enforcement.

highlights.title: Advice on accessing out-of-print art crime books
highlights.details: Tip that contacting authors directly can sometimes yield drafts of out-of-print books when market prices become prohibitive, useful for researchers on a budget.

mentions: Homeland Security Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program

channels.summary: Discussion mixed political history, human rights, and organized crime in the Asia–Pacific region, with several in-depth news links.

highlights.title: New York Times piece on Chinese general linked to Tiananmen Square
highlights.details: A New York Times article on a Chinese general associated with the Tiananmen Square crackdown was shared for regional political context.

highlights.title: Distinguishing antisemitism from criticism of the State of Israel
highlights.details: Users debated how opposition to Israeli state policies is often conflated with antisemitism, citing Neturei Karta and Satmar Hasidic communities and Joel Teitelbaum as examples of anti-Zionist yet Jewish positions.

highlights.title: Deportation of Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi and Prince Group’s role in pig-butchering scams
highlights.details: Article shared about Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi (Vincent Chen), founder of Prince Holding Group, being deported to China amid allegations of human trafficking, forced labor, and financial crimes linked to pig-butchering scams.

highlights.title: BBC coverage on regional Asia-Pacific issue
highlights.details: A BBC News article relevant to Asia-Pacific affairs was shared for additional background, though not discussed in detail in-channel.

channels.summary: Technical tips and investigative resources for tracking aircraft, plus news on aviation safety and fleet issues.

highlights.title: CPA SkyCircles for visualizing resolution advisories
highlights.details: Example shared of using cpa.skycircl.es with a KML track to analyze closest approaches and position reports during a resolution advisory, useful for reconstructing near-miss incidents.

highlights.title: Tweetdeck-style interface for LiveATC feeds
highlights.details: Blog post shared on building a Tweetdeck-style multi-column interface for LiveATC audio streams, helping analysts monitor multiple frequencies simultaneously.

highlights.title: BlueSky account tracking ICE aircraft via OSINT
highlights.details: A BlueSky account (jjindc.bsky.social) was recommended for those interested in OSINT-based tracking of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) aircraft movements.

highlights.title: ProPublica investigation into SpaceX launches and airline safety
highlights.details: ProPublica article examining how SpaceX launches and FAA oversight affect airline safety over Florida and the Caribbean was shared for aviation risk context.

highlights.title: AirNav Radar and ADS-B Exchange combo for blocked-flight destinations
highlights.details: Tip that with an AirNav Radar subscription you can see the filed flight plan route for ‘blocked’ aircraft and combine it with ADS-B Exchange to infer origin, destination, and routing early in a flight.

highlights.title: NTSB preliminary report on UPS Flight 2976 crash
highlights.details: Link to the NTSB investigation page for the UPS Flight 2976 crash in Kentucky was shared as an investigative update.

highlights.title: Russia restores old airframes to cope with airline fleet shortages
highlights.details: Moscow Times article reported that Russia is refurbishing older aircraft to address growing airline fleet shortages, relevant to tracking regional fleet composition and safety.

channels.summary: Shared a field-level assessment of Ukrainian-made thermobaric hand grenades’ reliability.

highlights.title: Review of Ukrainian RGT-27 S2 Thermobaric Hand Grenade malfunction
highlights.details: Video review by Ukrainian soldier Valgear shows the RGT-27 S2 thermobaric hand grenade failing, with only the booster charge detonating, raising concerns about the weapon’s effectiveness.

channels.summary: Ongoing work on mapping Central Asian military infrastructure and tracking regional security developments and disinformation narratives.

highlights.title: Oxus Society visualization of Tajik military units
highlights.details: Link to Oxus Society’s visualization of Tajikistan’s military units, useful for understanding force structure in the region.

highlights.title: Interactive map of 620+ military facilities in Uzbekistan (forthcoming)
highlights.details: User mentioned an upcoming interactive project mapping more than 620 military facilities across Uzbekistan, indicating substantial ongoing OSINT work.

highlights.title: DFRLab report on ‘biolabs’ disinformation in Armenia
highlights.details: Discussion highlighted a DFRLab report showing how ‘biolabs’ narratives used in Ukraine are being repurposed in Armenia, implicating CDC and USAID and even scientific conferences in conspiracy framing.

highlights.title: Euromaidan Press: Russian troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Article from Euromaidan Press on Moscow accelerating its troop buildup in Armenia amid rising tensions with Azerbaijan was shared.

highlights.title: Clarification on ‘initialed’ vs ‘signed’ peace deal in regional agreement
highlights.details: Tweet from clashreport was used to clarify that a peace agreement was only ‘initialed’ (agreeing on language) rather than fully signed and ratified.

channels.summary: Channel acknowledged recent contributions and logged a precise geolocation in Kherson oblast.

highlights.title: Geolocation ID 2547 – Kozats’ke & Vesele, Kherson (residential area)
highlights.details: Completed geolocation for ID 2547 pinpoints residential imagery in Kozats’ke and Vesele, Kherson, with coordinates and a Google Maps reference sourced from a Suspile Kherson Telegram post.

channels.summary: Meta channel for Bellingcat content where users shared podcasts, toolkits, reports, and updates on awards and communication channels.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit one-year anniversary
highlights.details: Celebration of the Bellingcat Toolkit’s first year, reminding users it is a curated, volunteer-maintained directory of open-source tools with use cases, guidance, and candid reviews.

highlights.title: Bellingcat 2024 Annual Report
highlights.details: Annual report shared detailing Bellingcat’s 2024 investigations, impact, and lessons learned for the future.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat podcast episodes
highlights.details: Multiple messages linked to Stage Talk episodes, including topics like US immigration raids, far-right fashion, ‘sketchy boats’, and mapping Central Asian armed forces.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp updates channel
highlights.details: Announcement that Bellingcat now has a WhatsApp channel for those who prefer receiving investigation updates directly in the app.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenge platform
highlights.details: Direct link to the challenge.bellingcat.com site where users can work through OSINT challenges and share approaches.

highlights.title: Award recognition for ‘Open Source Extremist Identifications’
highlights.details: Message congratulated Bellingcat contributors on recognition at the Online Journalism Awards for the ‘Open Source Extremist Identifications’ project.

channels.summary: Brief but focused sharing of disinformation-relevant job postings and research on why people embrace misinformation.

highlights.title: Danish linguist job likely tied to SOCOM information operations
highlights.details: GDIT Danish linguist job posting was flagged as likely supporting US SOCOM information operations targeting Danish media and audiences in Greenland.

highlights.title: Ars Technica: Why some people ‘win’ by believing misinformation
highlights.details: Article shared summarizing research on how believing misinformation can be psychologically or socially rewarding for some individuals, even after it is debunked.

channels.summary: Active sharing of environmental news, mapping tools, and climate-related research, plus community introductions and moderation.

highlights.title: Guardian: Mosquitoes found in Iceland as climate warms
highlights.details: Guardian article on mosquitoes being detected in Iceland for the first time, used to illustrate tangible local impacts of climate change.

highlights.title: Washington Post: US dams sinking and associated risks
highlights.details: Article and archive link on US dams subsiding and the resulting infrastructure and safety risks were shared for climate and engineering context.

highlights.title: Retraction of seminal glyphosate safety paper
highlights.details: A Mastodon-linked post noted that a key paper long used to justify glyphosate’s safety has been retracted due to concerns about authorship and misrepresented contributions, undermining a major pillar of regulatory arguments.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas deforestation mapping site
highlights.details: Shared as a good resource to visualize deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, Papua New Guinea, and Colombia via an interactive map interface.

highlights.title: Copernicus Marine Jupyter notebook tutorials
highlights.details: Copernicus’ Jupyter-based e-learning tutorials were recommended for environmental monitoring and analysis, useful for environmental OSINT workflows.

highlights.title: Grist: Miccosukee tribe and blocked land return bill at Alligator Alcatraz
highlights.details: Grist article shared on how the Miccosukee tribe blocked a controversial wildlife facility (‘Alligator Alcatraz’) and later faced a Trump-era veto on legislation intended to return their land.
